info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 9:33AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...ENHANCED FIRE DANGER IN WEST VIRGINIA TODAY... Relative Humidity values will lower to between 28 to 35 percent through early this afternoon, before gradually recovering through early this evening. Light southwest winds will increase 7 to 12 mph, with gusts of around 20 mph this afternoon. This combination of gusty winds and lower relative humidity will bring an increased threat of wildfire activity today. Fall fire season for the state of West Virginia runs from October 1st through December 31st. From October 1st through December 31st, West Virginia law prohibits all outdoor burning between the hours of 7am and 5pm. Fall is a dangerous time for forest fires in West Virginia as warm weather, and sometimes dry and windy conditions, often combines with dry leaves and dead grasses on the ground to create an enhanced fire danger. All burning between the hours of 7am and 5pm, or during extremely dry or windy conditions, should be avoided. When burning debris, supervise all fires until they are completely extinguished. Keep a rake, shovel, and a water source such as a hose nearby in case the fire does escape. Also, create a 10 foot perimeter around the fire so that it does not spread away from you. In addition, caution should be exercised to prevent fires from inadvertently starting, such as by avoiding smoking outdoors in fire prone areas, taking extra care to prevent sparks from equipment or machinery from triggering fire starts, and educating children about the dangers of playing with fire. For more information on West Virginia fire laws, contact the West Virginia Division of Forestry or your local fire department. If a fire does get out of control, call 911 immediately.
